channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Complicated Legacy of Frank Gehry’s Work
item.description: The legendary architect, who died last week, was an artist of self-expression.

item.title: The Florida Highwaymen: Outsider Art, Tourism, and American Landscape
item.description: The fascinating story of black artists whose flamboyant colors, ocean waves, and swaying palms defined Florida for a generation of tourists.

item.title: Even in Silicon Valley, skepticism looms over robots, while ‘China has certainly a lot more momentum on humanoids’
item.description: “The humanoid space has a very, very big hill to climb,” said Cosima du Pasquier, founder and CEO of Haptica Robotics.

item.title: Bolivia pivots to US as it breaks from China, Maduro and years of leftist rule
item.description: Bolivia seeks new US partnership under President Rodrigo Paz, pivoting from China dependence to attract American investment in lithium and technology.

item.title: How Euthanasia Gained a Foothold in Hospice Care
item.description: The concept of hospice was originally sold to the public as a better way to treat patients with terminal disease. The mission has been hijacked.

item.title: With just days to go before ACA subsidies expire, Congress is about to wrap up its work with no consensus solution in sight

item.title: Gen Z is drinking 20% less than Millennials. Productivity is rising. Coincidence? Not quite
item.description: The economics of alcohol are changing, and so is the definition of growth. Gen Z is drinking differently and it isn’t just a lifestyle trend.

item.title: Sen. Ron Johnson Asks DOJ To Investigate Judge Accused Of Misconduct In Trump Lawyers’ Trial

item.title: If Time Magazine Weren’t So Corrupt, It Would Have Made Charlie Kirk Person Of The Year

item.title: ADF: Employees Can’t Be Forced To Lie About Pronouns At Work
item.description: Employees don't have to insist on calling people by pronouns they don’t like. But they don’t have to say something they know is not true.
